content: The Act titled "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2010" expands the deduction for interest on education loans. The Act "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2010" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by repealing the dollar limitation and increasing the phaseout beginning point based on modified adjusted gross income. The Act "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2010" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by repealing the dollar limitation and increasing the phaseout beginning point based on modified adjusted gross income. The modified adjusted gross income excludes certain sections and applies adjustments before determining the adjusted gross income. The Act "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2010" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by adjusting the dollar amount based on the cost-of-living adjustment for taxable years starting after December 31, 2009. SEC. 3. EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. The allowable contributions for education savings accounts are increased from $2,000 to $5,000. Reports for these accounts must be filed by June 30 of the following year. These changes apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2009. SEC. 4. ALLOWANCE OF ROOM, BOARD, AND SPECIAL NEEDS SERVICES IN THE CASE OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND TUITION REDUCTION PROGRAMS WITH RESPECT TO HIGHER EDUCATION. In amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, the definition of qualified scholarship is expanded to include qualified higher education expenses for enrollment at eligible educational institutions. The terms 'qualified higher education expenses' and 'eligible educational institution' are defined in section 529(e). Additionally, changes are made to tuition reduction programs for teaching and research assistants. The amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include expanding the definition of qualified scholarship to cover qualified higher education expenses at eligible educational institutions. These changes also affect tuition reduction programs for teaching and research assistants, with an effective date after December 31, 2009. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 exempts sections 401 and 412 from the sunset provisions.
